title: Is it fairly common for authors to cite books that they haven't fully, or even partly, read? - Quora

response.answer_text: It would seem pointless to cite a book you haven’t even partly read, unless it’s as an item in a bibliography listing the most important or relevant works on a topic. I see no problem with citing information from a book you’ve only partly read, if there’s only one section in the text that happens to relate to your subject matter.
